interfaces

Interface RandomNumberGenerator

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MersenneTwister19937

    public interface RandomNumberGenerator
    Author:
    Marat Dukhan

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double nextChiSquared(double nu)
      Generates an chi-squared random variable with the number of degrees-of-freedom nu.
      double nextExponential(double mu)
      Generates an exponential random variable with scale parameter mu.
      double nextGamma(double alpha, double beta)
      Generates a gamma random variable with specified shape and rate parameters.
      int nextInt()
      Generates a random int.
      double nextLogNormal(double mu, double sigma)
      Generates a log-normal random variable with specified shape and log-scale parameter.
      double nextNormal()
      Generates a normal variable with zero mean and unit variance.
      double nextNormal(double mu, double sigma)
      Generates a normal variable with specified mean and standard deviation.
      long nextPoisson(double lambda)
      Generates a Poisson random variable with the specified mean and variance.
      double nextStudentT(double nu)
      Generates a Student-t random variable with specified degrees-of-freedom parameter.
      double nextUniform()
      Generates a random double in range [0, 1).
      double nextUniform(double a, double b)
      Generates a random double in range [a, b).

    • Method Detail

      • nextInt

        int nextInt()
        Generates a random int.
        Returns:
        A random int between Integer.MIN_VALUE (inclusive) and Integer.MAX_VALUE (inclusive).

      • nextUniform

        double nextUniform()
        Generates a random double in range [0, 1).
        Returns:
        A random double between 0 (including) and 1 (excluding).

      • nextUniform

        double nextUniform(double a,
                 double b)
        Generates a random double in range [a, b).
        Parameters:
        a - The lower bound of a support of the generated random variable. a must be no greater than b.
        b - The upper bound of a support of the generated random variable. b must be no less than a.
        Returns:
        A random double between a (including) and 1 (excluding).

      • nextNormal

        double nextNormal()
        Generates a normal variable with zero mean and unit variance.
        Returns:
        A standard normal random variable.

      • nextNormal

        double nextNormal(double mu,
                double sigma)
        Generates a normal variable with specified mean and standard deviation.
        Parameters:
        mu - The mean of the generated random variable.
        sigma - The standard deviation of the generated random variable. Must be greater than 0.
        Returns:
        A normal random variable with mean mu and standard deviation sigma.

      • nextLogNormal

        double nextLogNormal(double mu,
                   double sigma)
        Generates a log-normal random variable with specified shape and log-scale parameter.
        Parameters:
        mu - The log-scale parameter. mu is the mean of the natural logarithm of the generated random variable.
        sigma - The shape parameter. sigma is the standard deviation of the natural logarithm of the generated random variable. sigma must be greater than 0.
        Returns:
        A log-normal random variable with log-scale parameter mu and shape parameter sigma.

      • nextGamma

        double nextGamma(double alpha,
               double beta)
        Generates a gamma random variable with specified shape and rate parameters.
        Parameters:
        alpha - The shape parameter of the gamma distribution. alpha must be greater than 0.
        beta - The rate parameter of the gamma distribution. beta must be greater than 0.
        Returns:
        A gamma variable with shape parameter alpha and rate parameter beta.

      • nextStudentT

        double nextStudentT(double nu)
        Generates a Student-t random variable with specified degrees-of-freedom parameter.
        Parameters:
        nu - The degrees-of-freedom parameter. Must be greater than 0.
        Returns:
        A Student-t random variable with nu degrees of freedom.

      • nextExponential

        double nextExponential(double mu)
        Generates an exponential random variable with scale parameter mu.
        Parameters:
        mu - Scale parameter. The mean of the random variable to be generated equals mu. mu must be greater than 0.
        Returns:
        An exponential random variable with scale parameter mu.

      • nextChiSquared

        double nextChiSquared(double nu)
        Generates an chi-squared random variable with the number of degrees-of-freedom nu.
        Parameters:
        nu - The degrees-of-freedom parameter. Must be greater than 0.
        Returns:
        A chi-squared random variable with nu degrees of freedom.

      • nextPoisson

        long nextPoisson(double lambda)
        Generates a Poisson random variable with the specified mean and variance.
        Parameters:
        lambda - The mean and variance of the Poisson distribution. Must be greater than 0.
        Returns:
        A Poisson random variable with mean and variance lambda.
